articles.author: Andrew Mills, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: If successful, the planned phased ceasefire could halt fighting that has left much of Gaza in ruins, displaced most of the enclave's pre-war population of 2.3 million, killed tens of thousands of people, and ease tensions across the wider Middle East.
articles.title: Negotiators appear close to sealing Gaza ceasefire deal

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: President Joe Biden will cap his half-century political career with a final Oval Office speech, hoping to cement a legacy that has been overshadowed by Democrats' failure to stop Donald Trump from returning to the White House.
articles.title: Biden bids farewell from Oval Office as Trump looms over his legacy

articles.author: Gram Slattery
articles.description: Advisers to President-elect Donald Trump now concede that the Ukraine war will take months or even longer to resolve, a sharp reality check on his biggest foreign policy promise - to strike a peace deal on his first day in the White House.
articles.title: Trump advisers concede Ukraine peace deal is months away

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean authorities investigating impeached President Yoon Seok Yeol were at his official residence on Wednesday to execute an arrest warrant over insurrection accusations related to his Dec. 3 martial law declaration.
articles.title: South Korea authorities at President Yoon's residence to execute arrest warrant

articles.author: Andrea Shalal, Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: With just days to go in his presidency, U.S. President Joe Biden is releasing a flurry of new measures that challenge China's chip-making and shipbuilding and limit Russian oil, while a ceasefire in Gaza is said to be in reach after months of failed talks.
articles.title: Biden's late moves on China, Russia, AI may mostly boost Trump

articles.author: Nellie Peyton, Bhargav Acharya
articles.description: A total of 78 bodies and 166 survivors - some of them emaciated and disorientated - have been hauled out so far in a court-ordered rescue operation, with hundreds more men still stuck 2 km (1.5 miles) below the surface in a gold mine at Stilfontein, southwest of Johannesburg.
articles.title: South Africa accused of 'horrific' crackdown as 78 corpses pulled from besieged mine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The agreement follows months of on-off negotiations brokered by Egyptian and Qatari mediators, with the backing of the US.
articles.title: Israel, Hamas reach ceasefire deal designed to end 15-month Gaza war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The threat of powerful wind gusts, combined with bone-dry humidity, in Los Angeles on Wednesday could test firefighters who have been battling to keep monstrous fires in Los Angeles in check since last week.
articles.title: Wind gusts, humidity may test firefighters battling Los Angeles blazes

articles.author: Antoni Slodkowski, James Pomfret
articles.description: For years, the U.S. government has urged China to show "restraint" in pushing its claim on Taiwan and to drop military threats to bring the democratically governed island under its control.
articles.title: Trump's Greenland bid stirs debate in China about what to do with Taiwan

articles.author: Aaron Ross, Edwin Okoth
articles.description: A Kenyan cabinet minister said his son's abduction during last year's anti-government protests was carried out by the National Intelligence Service and that his son was released after President William Ruto personally intervened.
articles.title: Kenyan minister says son was abducted by intelligence service
